Package controller

Class BattleshipController

java.lang.Object
controller.BattleshipController
public class BattleshipController extends Object
This class represents the controller component of the Battleship game that use the MVC architecture. The controller takes in user input from the view and determines if the user placed the ship correctly. Once input is validated, it gives the input to the model. This class also determines when the game is over. Basically, the controller handles all of the game logistics.
Author:
Luke Genova, Amimul Ehsan Zoha

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      This method is used to determine if the game is over. Checks how many hits the current player has. If the current player's fleet withstood the max number of hits they can, then the game is over and notifies the other player.
      Returns:
      A boolean whether the game has ended or not.

    • getPlayerAnswerGrid

      public POSITION_RESULT[][] getPlayerAnswerGrid()
      Returns a grid that contains the locations of all the attacks the current player had made to the opposing player's grid.
      Returns:
      a grid that contains the locations of all the attacks the current player had made to the opposing player's grid.

    • updateOpponentGrid

      public void updateOpponentGrid(POSITION_RESULT[][] updatedGrid, boolean gameEnded)
      This method takes in an updated grid from the opposing player that resulted from the current player's move and updates its current information of the opponent's grid.
      Parameters:
      updatedGrid - A grid of constants that represents the opponent's updated grid after the current player made a move.
      gameEnded - A boolean value that determines if the view can show the opponents ship locations after the game ends.

    • addShip

      public void addShip(Point coord, int size, int dir) throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method checks for any potential exceptions that can occur when the user places a ship, then passes the necessary values to the model.
      Parameters:
      coord - A Point object that holds the x and y position on the ship will be placed.
      size - An integer that holds the size of the ship.
      dir - An integer that determines which direction the user is going to place their ship.
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - An exception that occurs when the user tried to place something in a position that already had something or when a move made is not allowed.

    • moveResult

      public void moveResult(Point coord)
      This method passes the move the other player made to the model to update the data within the model.
      Parameters:
      coord - A Point object that holds the x and y position on the ship will be placed.

    • filledSpaceFound

      private boolean filledSpaceFound(Point coord, int size, int dir)
      This private method checks if the current player already placed a ship in any of the positions where the next ship will be.
      Parameters:
      coord - A Point object that holds the x and y position on the ship will be placed.
      size - An integer that holds the size of the ship.
      dir - An integer that determines which direction the user is going to place their ship.
      Returns:
      A boolean value (either true or false) that determines whether the current player already placed a ship in any of the positions where the next ship will be.

    • checkShipPlacement

      private boolean checkShipPlacement(Point coord, int size, int dir)
      This private method checks if the current player's ship placement goes out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      coord - A Point object that holds the x and y position on the ship will be placed.
      size - An integer that holds the size of the ship.
      dir - An integer that determines which direction the user is going to place their ship.
      Returns:
      A boolean value (either true or false) that determines whether the current player's ship placement goes out of bound.
